snippet: Justices revived a state law that bans people from collecting other voters’ completed absentee ballots and submitting them to election officials....
abstract: Supreme Court order permits Arizona to enforce ban on practice of 'ballot harvesting,' in which one person collects and submits absentee ballots completed by others; opponents of law say it disproportionately affects minority voters, especially Native Americans.
lead_paragraph: Justices revived a state law that bans people from collecting other voters’ completed absentee ballots and submitting them to election officials.

headline.main: Arizona Can Ban ‘Ballot Harvesting,’ Supreme Court Says
headline.print_headline: Court Lets Arizona Ban ‘Harvesting’ of Ballots
